intro: Hybanthus portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican hybanthus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and heart-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has white or pale purple flowers that bloom during the summer months. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
